availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David M. Vincent (Hopkins Co, ky, pvt 25th/17th Ky Infantry)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Lucinda Vincent. Married to Sarah Vincent. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Hopkins County in 1864. Enlisted in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private on January 1, 1862. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 1, 1862, to January 23, 1865. Reported as deserted October 9, 1862. Returned to duty by December 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 130A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 960.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0307.
